abstract: Seeking to avoid a new trans-Atlantic trade clash, EADS played down a G.A.O. report that found flaws in its bid to make refueling tankers with its U.S. partner, Northrop Grumman.
snippet: Seeking to avoid a new trans-Atlantic trade clash, EADS played down a G.A.O. report that found flaws in its bid to make refueling tankers with its U.S. partner, Northrop Grumman.
lead_paragraph: PARIS  Seeking to avoid a new trans-Atlantic trade clash, the European Aeronautic Defense and Space Company and European politicians played down on Thursday a report that might jeopardize a $35 billion United States military contract awarded to EADS in partnership with Northrop Grumman.

headline.main: Europe Plays Down Setback in U.S. Tanker Bid
headline.print_headline: Europe, Officially Calm, Reacts to Tanker Move

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co

byline.original: By Matthew Saltmarsh and Leslie Wayne
